question: Is metoprolol metabolized by CYP2D6?
ideal_answer: Yes, metoprolol is metabolized by CYP2D6.

snippets.text: Among these beta-blockers atenolol is mainly eliminated by renal excretion, bisoprolol is in part excreted as parent compound via the renal route (50%), the other 50% are hepatically metabolised, whereas metoprolol and carvedilol are metabolised by CYP2D6.
